title: Google's customer service is shockingly bad, it's actually comical.
content:
I received a Google Pixel 3a XL last september as a birthday gift. It worked wonderfully and was a great phone but abruptly died after about 5 months. Zero damage, the phone never left its case, there was no reason for it. Google at first completely refused to help me in any way, because I live in Canada. Apparently all customers outside of the USA are second class, and not worth Google's attention. After battling them for over a month, they agreed to look at the phone. But of course, would not touch the phone if it did not come from an American address. So after using an expensive re-shipping service and waiting two months, I finally receive a replacement phone. And of course, its locked to an American cell provider, rendering it useless to me. 

I am truly speechless, I'm not even angry anymore. Google took my money and then spit in my face. I've never been treated so poorly by a company. I just wanted to buy a phone that works. This is fucking ridiculous. I wish I never purchased this piece of shit product. I am going to make it my life's passion to steer future customers away from this asshole company.
